Package animation.demo

Class AnimatedObjectDemo

java.lang.Object
animation.demo.AnimatedObjectDemo
All Implemented Interfaces:
AnimatedObject
public class AnimatedObjectDemo
extends java.lang.Object
implements AnimatedObject
A demo of what an animated object might look like. In this case, we have a small black circle that moves from left to right across the window. When it reaches the right edge of the window, it bounces and goes to the left edge. At the left edge, it bounces and goes right.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AnimatedObjectDemo​(AbstractAnimation animation)
    Creates the animated object

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Draws a black circle at its current location.
      Specified by:
      paint in interface AnimatedObject
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to draw on.

    • nextFrame

      public void nextFrame()
      Moves the ball a small amount. If it reaches the left or right edge, it bounces.
      Specified by:
      nextFrame in interface AnimatedObject

    • up

      public void up()
      Demo of action to take when the user clicks the up arrow button. This moves the ball up slightly and prints Up on the console.

    • right

      public void right()
      Demo of action to take when the user clicks the right arrow button. This prints Right on the console.

    • left

      public void left()
      Demo of action to take when the user clicks the left arrow button. This prints Left on the console.

    • space

      public void space()
      Demo of action to take when the user clicks the space key. This prints Space on the console.
